A reverse mortgage loan that is not insured under 12 U.S.C. § 1715z-20 is not subject to the provisions in 12 U.S.C. § 1715z-20, or in any regulations or guidance adopted under 12 U.S.C. § 1715z-20, that:
Limit origination fees to $6,000 as adjusted under 12 U.S.C. § 1715z-20(r);
Impose maximum claim amounts or other loan limit restrictions; or
Require government insurance for the loan.

A lender or an arranger of financing is not subject to the federal regulatory approval requirements of 24 C.F.R., Part 202 when making or arranging a reverse mortgage loan that is not insured under 12 U.S.C. § 1715z-20.
